title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 69.2 - Credits to surplus account of savings and loan associations
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 69.2 - Credits to surplus account of savings and loan associations

State Regulations

When the net profits of any savings and loan association have
been determined at the close of an accounting period, if its surplus account
does not equal 10 per centum of its capital, five per centum of such net
profits shall be credited to its surplus account, or so much thereof less than
five per centum as will make such surplus account equal to 10 per centum of its
capital. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3
ยง
69.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
